DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Blinatumomab Infusion Interruption Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the yes/no indicator if Blinatumomab infusion was interrupted greater than 4 hours.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Blinatumomab Infusion Procedure Interruption Greater Four Hour Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes._Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord._A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something._Notable in size, number, measure, magnitude, degree, or effectiveness._A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one._A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Blinatumomab Infusion Procedure Interruption Greater Four Hour Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.:Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.:A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.:Notable in size, number, measure, magnitude, degree, or effectiveness.:A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.:A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.
Notable in size, number, measure, magnitude, degree, or effectiveness.
A natural number greater than 3 and less than 5 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of three and one.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
